Package org.elasticsearch.action

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    ActionFuture<T>
    An extension to Future allowing for simplified "get" operations.
    ActionListener<Response>
    A listener for action responses or failures.
    CompositeIndicesRequest
    Needs to be implemented by all ActionRequest subclasses that are composed of multiple subrequests which relate to one or more indices.
    DocumentRequest<T>
    Generic interface to group ActionRequest, which work on single document level Forces this class return index/type/id getters
    IndicesRequest
    Needs to be implemented by all ActionRequest subclasses that relate to one or more indices.
    IndicesRequest.Replaceable  
    ListenableActionFuture<T>
    An ActionFuture that listeners can be added to.
    ShardOperationFailedException
    An exception indicating that a failure occurred performing an operation on the shard.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    Action<Request extends ActionRequest,Response extends ActionResponse,RequestBuilder extends ActionRequestBuilder<Request,Response,RequestBuilder,Client>,Client extends ElasticsearchClient>
    Base action.
    ActionModule  
    ActionRequest<T extends ActionRequest>  
    ActionRequestBuilder<Request extends ActionRequest,Response extends ActionResponse,RequestBuilder extends ActionRequestBuilder,Client extends ElasticsearchClient>  
    ActionResponse
    Base class for responses to action requests.
    ActionRunnable<Response>
    Base class for Runnables that need to call ActionListener.onFailure(Throwable) in case an uncaught exception or error is thrown while the actual action is run.
    ClientAction<Request extends ActionRequest,Response extends ActionResponse,RequestBuilder extends ActionRequestBuilder<Request,Response,RequestBuilder,Client>>
    Action (used with Client API).
    GenericAction<Request extends ActionRequest,Response extends ActionResponse>
    A generic action.
    LatchedActionListener<T>
    An action listener that allows passing in a CountDownLatch that will be counted down after onResponse or onFailure is called
    OriginalIndices
    Used to keep track of original indices within internal (e.g.
    TransportActionNodeProxy<Request extends ActionRequest,Response extends ActionResponse>
    A generic proxy that will execute the given action against a specific node.
    ValidateActions  
  • Enum Summary 
    Enum Description
    ThreadingModel  
    WriteConsistencyLevel
    Write Consistency Level control how many replicas should be active for a write operation to occur (a write operation can be index, or delete).

    ActionRequestValidationException  
    FailedNodeException  
    NoShardAvailableActionException  
    NoSuchNodeException  
    PrimaryMissingActionException  
    RoutingMissingException  
    TimestampParsingException  
    UnavailableShardsException  
    WriteFailureException
